title: Australia's best tap water revealed - and the best-rating H20 is NOWHERE near our big cities
text:
The best tap water in the country has been revealed in an Australia-wide competition.

The top drops from each state were compared to each other in a taste-test in Victoria on Saturday.

Water from Mackay Regional Council in Queensland took out the title of the best H2O in the nation.

Stuart Boyd (left) from Mackay Regional Council accepts the award for the best tap water in the country from official Rohan Storey (right)

The state finalists lined up at the competition table with coffee beans to cleanse the officials palates

AUSTRALIA'S BEST TAP WATER STATE FINALIST NSW Shoalhaven Water, Bamarang WTP (Nowra) Tasmania TasWater, Mount Leslie WTP (Launceston) South Australia SA Water, Swan Reach WTP (Swan Reach) Victoria – Barwon Water, Wurdee Boluc WTP (Geelong) Queensland – Mackay Regional Council, Marian WTP (Mackay) Western Australia – Water Corporation, Mundaring WTP (Perth – Kalgoolie)

Mackay beat samples from Kalgoolie in Western Australia, Launceston in Tasmania, Swan Reach in South Australia, Geelong in Victoria, and Nowra in New South Wales.

Competition official and chief operations officer at Water Industry Operators of Australia Craig Mathisen said that the best water had no taste at all.

'The ultimate sample is one that has no taste at all,' he told 3AW's Neil Mitchell.

But he did concede it is subjective and the same water won't be everyone's favourite.

'Everyone's taste is individual,' he said.

Mackay's water was voted the best, according to Mr Mathisen, because the crystal clear source water starts in the Queensland sub-tropical rainforest and flows down through the Pioneer River into Mackay.

Mr Mathisen said that his organisation decided to conduct the competition to recognise the hard work of those in the industry.

'Generally, if you ask people on the street where their water comes from, they'll just say it's from the tap. But there's a lot that happens to that water before it gets there, and this is our way to honor the hard work of those people who ensure the best water coming from the tap every day.'

Representatives from each state attended the event in Victoria on Saturday

The event was held at by the Wannon Water facility in Dunkfield, Victoria who won last years competition
description: You may not think twice about the water out of your tap, but not all water is created equally. The best tap water in the country has been revealed in an Australia-wide competition.
authors: Brett Lackey For Daily Mail Australia
